name: Bhindi Masala
recipeInstructions: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
Now add minced garlic and ginger paste and sauté for another minute.
Add the turmeric, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Mix well.
Stir in the can of diced tomatoes and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and let it simmer for 20 minutes or until the okra is tender.
Serve hot with steaming basmati rice.
description: Bhindi Masala is a classic North Indian dish made by sautéing the okra in spices and served over steaming basmati rice. This recipe showcases the flavors of India with its blend of spices and herbs.
image: A steaming plate of Bhindi Masala garnished with fresh cilantro and served with a side of basmati rice.
